data.name: Hats protoDAO
data.description:
This hat is worn by the protoDAO itself, via [Hats protoDAO's moloch v3 interface](https://admin.daohaus.fun/#/molochv3/0xa/0xcf4b2e60273da3718fd16ee0d4cb176247ecc28a). 

Hats protoDAO exists to 1) create and steward the best possible organizational primitive for roles (Hats), and 2) explore and curate the vast design space of how to use the protocol to solve real problems. 

It does this by: 
- establishing valuable connections between members of the ecosystem, 
- developing net new functionality for the ecosystem around the protocol, and 
- governing the commons. 

As a protoDAO that is not yet a true DAO, it aims to set the foundations of a strong network and effective mechanisms that will serve as the catalysts and basis for a world-class DAO that can govern the Hats Protocol commons for decades to come.

data.name: Hats Community Member
data.description:
The Hats Community Member Hat signifies participation in the Hats Community, and gives the wearer access to the Hats Protocol Charmverse space and the Hats Community Telegram channel.

[Claim the Community Member Hat here](https://hatsprotocol.deform.cc/community) with agreement of the [Hats Community Agreements and Code of Conduct](https://app.charmverse.io/hats-protocol/page-5790577709721176)

responsibilities.label: Follow Community Agreements
responsibilities.description: Conduct yourself in a manner that is consistent with the Hats Community Agreements and Code of Conduct, which you signed in order to claim this hat

authorities.label: Access to the Hats Community Telegram group
authorities.description: Read & write access in the Hats Community Telegram group

authorities.label: Read access on the Hats Protocol Charmverse
Access to the Hats Protocol Forum
authorities.description: For more information about the forum, see this post: https://forum.hatsprotocol.xyz/t/welcome-to-hats-protocol-community-forum/

authorities.label: Access to Hats Town Hall and Deep Dive meetings
authorities.description: These typically happen on Zoom and are published on a shared Hats Protocol Ecosystem calendar and announced in the community telegram

criteria.label: Agree to and uphold the Hats Community Agreements and Code of Conduct

data.name: Hats Contributor
data.description: Contributors are all those making meaningful contributions to the development of the Hats Protocol ecosystem.

authorities.description: Eligible to apply to become a steward of the protoDAO for the following Season (applications open at the midpoint of each Season)

criteria.label: Make substantial, ongoing contributions to the Hats project within the past season, as assessed by the wearers of the Hats Community Coordinator hat. Contributions could come in the form of a verified contribution submission or a merged pull request to one of the Hats Protocol Github repos.
Fulfill the responsibilities above, at the discretion of the Community Coordination hat wearers.

data.name: Hats Steward
data.description:
Stewards collectively govern the shared resources of Hats protoDAO (such as those listed in the Authorities section below) and support the progressive decentralization of the project. 

For more details on this role, [see this link](https://app.charmverse.io/hats-protocol/page-6153647704903524)

responsibilities.label: Declare seasonal contribution intentions
responsibilities.description: Declare your intentions for how you will contribute to Hats Protocol and/or the Hats protoDAO for the coming Season

responsibilities.label: Attend Steward meetings
responsibilities.description: Attending at least 2/3 of the protoDAO Season Launch Convenings and Steward Council Meetings each season

responsibilities.label: Participate in discussion and vote on protoDAO proposals
responsibilities.description: Meaningfully participate in debate and discussion in, and/or vote on, at least 60% of protoDAO proposals

responsibilities.label: Participate in the Hats protoDAO Telegram channel
responsibilities.description: Track and participate actively in the Hats protoDAO Telegram channel

responsibilities.label: Participate in protoDAO Gov Week
responsibilities.description: Participate in protoDAO Gov Week in the last week of the Season. The specific responsibilities of the week include: completing the seasonal Contribution Recognition & Rewards survey; completing the protoDAO sensemaking survey; and reviewing any open protoDAO proposals)

authorities.description:
Create, vote on, and execute proposals for the Hats protoDAO

New Stewards that already have protoREP should make a `reboard()` transaction in the token gate link to convert it to protoVOTEs. 

New Stewards that don't yet have protoREP should make an `onboard()` transaction in the token gate link to receive their starting 100 protoVOTEs.

data.name: Hats Arbitrator
data.description: Hats protoDAO Arbitrators support the healthy evolution of the protoDAO by helping to address code of conduct violation submissions and navigate conflicts with an eye towards reaching resolutions that uphold the community's values and that reach towards a restorative approach rather than a punitive one as much as possible.

criteria.label: Fulfill the responsibilities detailed above, at the discretion of the accountability address

data.name: protoDAO Coordinator
data.description:
The protoDAO Coordinator is responsible for coordinating all aspects of the protoDAO, cultivating a strong network and effective mechanisms that will serve as the catalysts and basis for a world-class DAO that can govern the Hats Protocol commons for decades to come.

The responsibilities below are currently pinned onto the protoDAO Coordinator hat, but they could be decentralized over time and spin out into separate hats.

responsibilities.label: Progressively decentralize this role
responsibilities.description: Supporting the progressive decentralization of this role by identifying the more specific responsibilities associated with each of the high-level responsibilities outlined below

responsibilities.label: Facilitate protoDAO meetings
responsibilities.description: Facilitation: guiding the Hats Community and protoDAO members through group processes to find common ground and collaborate with one another. Facilitators design and lead calls and convenings, hold space for different points of view, and help conversations flow.

responsibilities.label: Weave relationships between protoDAO members
responsibilities.description: Weaving: fostering new connections and deepening relationships. Weavers engage with participants to gather input, introduce participants to each other to inspire self-organization, and build bridges with new parts of the ecosystem to help the network grow.

responsibilities.label: Manage protoDAO operations and internal systems
responsibilities.description: Operations: organizing the protoDAOâ€™s internal systems, mechanisms, and structures to enable participants to engage effectively, share information, and advance collective work. Operators establish and maintain protoDAO operations, support knowledge management, and provide back-of-the-house assistance for protoDAO projects and workstreams.

authorities.label: Lead design and facilitation for protoDAO calls and convenings
Admin access in protoDAO systems
authorities.description: Admin authorities for protoDAO communication channels, workspaces, and tools, including Telegram, Charmverse, Snapshot, Coordinape, Zoom, and Google Workspaces

data.name: Modules Registry Curator
data.description: The role of the Modules Registry Curator is to ensure a high standard of quality and usability for modules within the Hats Ecosystem. They do so by reviewing and approving submissions and modifications to the Hats Modules Registry in accordance with the curation guidelines and in collaboration with fellow Curators and the protoDAO at large.

responsibilities.label: Review Registry repo submissions
responsibilities.description: Review submissions and modification requests in accordance with the Curation Rubric

responsibilities.label: Respond within the Curation Cadence
responsibilities.description: Review submissions and modification requests in accordance with the Curation Cadence

responsibilities.label: Uphold the standard of safety and usability
Make improvement recommendations
responsibilities.description: Provide input to the Module Curation Mechanism Committee on ways to improve the Registry and curation mechanism.

authorities.label: Approve module submission PRs
authorities.description: Approve module submission PRs in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Merge PRs when approved by 2 or more Curators

data.name: Module Curation Manager
data.description: The role of the Modules Registry Manager is to foster a healthy ecosystem of Hats Modules. They do so by governing the Hats Modules Registry mechanisms in collaboration with other Managers and the protoDAO at large.

responsibilities.label: Maintain the Registry and curation mechanism
responsibilities.description: Ensure the Registry and curation mechanism meet design goals and improve over time.

responsibilities.label: Propose new mechanisms to improve Registry curation
responsibilities.description: Investigate, develop and propose new mechanisms to improve Registry curation and foster a healthy ecosystem of Hats Modules.

authorities.label: Approve PRs to the submission schema
authorities.description: Approve PRs to change the submission schema in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Approve PRs to the curation cadence
authorities.description: Approve PRs to change the curation cadence in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Merge PRs when approved by 2 or more Managers

data.name: CEO
data.description:
Haberdasher Labs is temporarily transitioning into a structure with a single hierarchical leader for the purpose of and during the time of fundraising.

This role is held accountable to [established agreements and intentions](https://app.charmverse.io/haberdasherlabs/ceo-952399732884559) both by the Haberdashers and by a majority of current team members.

authorities.label: Solely direct team resources
authorities.description:
Solely direct the resources of the team toward the complicated goal of fundraising over a constrained time period:
- Time and attention
- Communications
- Support from broader network

data.name: Ecosystem
data.description: https://app.charmverse.io/haberdasherlabs/page-2266508852572231

data.name: Ecosystem Lead
data.description:
- The Ecosystem Lead role is focused on cultivating a highly engaged ecosystem of contributors (including community members, active contributors, and stewards) in order to create and steward the best possible organizational primitive and solution-set for roles (Hats). This will involve catalyzing the Hats ecosystem to explore and curate the vast design space of ways of using that primitive to solve real problems, and to develop sticky network effects associated with the canonical version of the protocol.
- The primary metrics for success of this role areÂ 
  - number and growth rate of contributor + steward hat wearers (as combined they are a reflection of all the folks who are actively contributing to the protoDAO) with a growth rate target of 40% from Seasons 1 to 2, as well asÂ 
  - number and growth rate of community hat wearers (a reflection of the size of the reach/periphery of the protoDAO) with a growth rate target of 100% from Seasons 0 to 1 and 1 to 2.Â

data.name: Technology Lead
data.description:
- The Technology Lead role is focused on stewarding the Hats Protocol technology stack as well as the team(s) contributing to its development. It holds the â€œwholeâ€ of the tech stack and is concerned with its security, quality, capture-resistance, and strategic value.
- Success for this role is measured by a subjective / fuzzy combination of problem-technology fit trajectory and building velocity, mediated by decentralization trajectory and security, for the Hats Protocol technology stack.

responsibilities.label: Ensure security of the Hats Protocol Stack
responsibilities.description: Security: ensure that the tech stack is sufficiently resistant to attack

responsibilities.label: Ensure quality of the Hats Protocol Stack
responsibilities.description: Quality: ensure that the tech stack is sufficiently free of bugs

responsibilities.label: Ensure decentralization of the Hats Protocol Stack
responsibilities.description: Decentralization: ensure that the tech stack is sufficiently resistant to capture

responsibilities.label: Facilitate productivity across the team
responsibilities.description: Productivity: foster a high-velocity culture that is appropriately balanced with security, quality, and decentralization considerations

responsibilities.label: Ensure composability of the Hats Protocol Stack
responsibilities.description: Modularity and Composability: ensure that the tech stack is sufficiently modular and composable with other protocols and applications

responsibilities.label: Orchestrate Hats Protocol Stack components
responsibilities.description: Orchestration: ensure that the various components of the tech stack work well together and collectively serve the Hats ecosystemâ€™s strategic objectives

authorities.label: Drive the Hats technology roadmap
authorities.description: Drive the full stack technology roadmap, under advisement from Haberdashers, Strategy Lead, Product Lead, Protocol Lead, and other Technology roles.

authorities.label: Github Super-admin
authorities.description: Super-admin authority for the Hats Protocol Github organization

data.name: Protocol Lead
data.description:
- The Protocol Lead role is focused on researching, building, and maintaining the best possible manifestation of Hats Protocol and its related smart contract infrastructure.
- Success for this role is measured by a subjective assessment of how well the protocol continues to meet the needs of its stakeholders over time.

responsibilities.label: Identify wearer and ecosystem problems
responsibilities.description: Innovation: advance protocol functionality by finding solutions to wearers and ecosystem problems

responsibilities.label: Lead Protocol development
responsibilities.description: Development: build and maintain the Hats Protocol smart contract system

responsibilities.label: Ensure Protocol security
responsibilities.description: Security: ensure that the protocol is sufficiently resistant to attack and bug free

responsibilities.label: Ensure Protocol decentralization
responsibilities.description: Decentralization: ensure that the protocol itself is sufficiently resistant to capture

data.name: Docs Manager
data.description:
- Maintainer of the Hats Protocol Docs. The Docs include both App-related and Protocol/Infra/Dev-related content, and are currently both under the responsibility of this hat.
- The roleâ€™s general operation is to coordinate the teamâ€™s attention over the Docs, in accordance with the ongoing needs and various considerations.
- Although this role includes the ability to delegate responsibility to people over content, its spirit is to first self-delegate, striving to minimize peopleâ€™s required attention over the Docs.

data.name: Marketing Lead
data.description:
The Marketing Lead role is focused on increasing awareness of Hats among our target audiences, and getting qualified prospects (those who have good fit and readiness to use or build on Hats) into the Hats funnel. 

The primary metrics for success of this role are: 
1. number of qualified prospect users in our funnel, as tracked in 3RM and
2. number of qualified prospect builders in our funnel, as tracked in 3RM

data.name: Technical Partnerships Lead
data.description: The Technical Partnerships Lead role is focused on developing high-value technical partnerships between Hats Protocol (currently primarily represented by Haberdasher Labs) and other projects, protocols, and applications. High-value technical partnerships lead to key integrations and compositions that significantly expand the Hats Protocol value proposition to wearers and/or builders.
